intro: Catostigma inconstans, commonly known as the variable catostigma, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in wet, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed habitats. The species is noted for its variability in flower color and leaf shape, contributing to its common name.
